text: Charles Byron Renfrew (October 31, 1928 - December 14, 2017) was an American federal judge and politician. He was born in Detroit, Michigan. He was a member of the Democratic Party. He studied at Princeton University and at the University of Michigan. Renfrew served as the Judge of the United States District Court for the Northern District of California after being appointed by President Richard Nixon. He served as judge from 1971 through 1980. He then served as United States Deputy Attorney General from 1980 to 1981 under the Jimmy Carter administration. Renfrew died on December 14, 2017 in San Francisco, California at the age of 89. ==References== ==Other websites== * Charles Byron Renfrew biography Category:1928 births Category:2017 deaths Category:Lawyers from Detroit Category:American judges Category:Politicians from Detroit Category:Democratic Party (United States) politicians Category:United States Deputy Attorneys General Category:Lawyers from San Francisco Category:Politicians from San Francisco
title: Charles Byron Renfrew
